attributes.action: Fund the ultrasound of all female first born babies for hip dysplasia
attributes.additional_details: Symptoms of hip dysplasia can often present later in the child’s life, and could mean that the child has to undergo invasive surgeries, sometimes multiple times. These surgeries can be very invasive and could be avoided if picked up by an ultrasound at birth. Sometimes the surgeries are unsuccessful resulting in the child being likely to struggle when they are older. Surgeries can cost the NHS a lot of money and could be avoided if more money was put into preventative care.
attributes.background: We ask the Government to fund ultrasound scans to help rule out hip dysplasia for, ideally all babies, but at least female first born babies who are most at risk.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

signatures_by_constituency.mp: Rt Hon Sir John Hayes MP
signatures_by_constituency.name: South Holland and The Deepings
